name: Movies with Colors in the Title Trivia Game | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Alan Ladd starred in "The Blue Dahlia". Which statement describes the plot?
questions.correct: Ladd returns from military service and has problems with his wife
options: Ladd is involved in a dispute between factions
Ladd is investigating the gruesome killing of a young girl
questions.explanation:
Ladd returns from military service and has problems with his wife.

	Ladd is a paid killer in "This Gun for Hire". The "dispute between factions" is part of the storyline in "Shane". The murder of a young girl describes the famous "Black Dahlia" murder (which happened subsequent to the movie's release), but is not a part of the storyline of this movie.

questions.text: Who starred in the sci-fi movie "Soylent Green"?
questions.explanation:
Charlton Heston.

	Not to be confused with another sci-fi movie, "The Green Slime".

questions.text: The movie "Riders of the Purple Sage" was based on a novel by what popular, western author?
questions.explanation:
Zane Grey.

	Many say that it is Grey's best novel (and one of the best western stories ever written). Tom Mix starred in an early version.

Peter Sellers.

	Many people find Inspector Clouseau irresistible. This is certainly one of the roles for which Sellers is best-known.

questions.text: Theresa Russell starred in which of these "black" movies?
questions.explanation:
Black Widow.

	Russell starred with Debra Winger in "Widow". "Rain" starred Michael Douglas, "Bird" starred George Segal (in a send-up of "The Maltese Falcon", "Black Like Me" starred James Whitmore (in a movie based on a true story).

questions.text: Burt Lancaster starred in which of these "red" movies?
options: The Wake of the Red Witch
questions.explanation:
The Crimson Pirate.

	Lancaster was the "Pirate". "Wake" was a seagoing tale with John Wayne, "Badge" starred Audie Murphy (although other versions of the movie have been made). "Scarlet" has also been made more than once; a recent version (with Demi Moore) was panned by most critics.

Charlton Heston.

	This is Heston (again) in a tale of a submarine with problems.

questions.text: Which of the following appeared in "White Christmas"?
questions.explanation:
Rosemary Clooney.

	Bing Crosby starred. Danny Kaye and Vera-Ellen rounded out the cast.

questions.text: Who played "The Unsinkable Molly Brown" in the movie of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Debbie Reynolds.

	Do people remember how versatile she was? Actress, singer, dancer, etc.

questions.text: Who starred in "The Yellow Rose of Texas"?
questions.explanation:
Roy Rogers.

	The song is remembered by many; the movie is not. With Dale Evans.
